alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over San Acacia, or 15 miles north of Socorro, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lemitar, La Joya, San Acacia, Chamizal and Contreras. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 156 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; West Central Highlands
